name: 國際經濟
restrict: ◎必須先修過(也可以同時修)【PGUA007  統計學】、【BAU0040  統計學（一）】其中一門 ◎課程開放上修
description: This graduate-level course focuses on international trade theory and its application to trade and policy issues. The course will expose MBA students to traditional and alternative economic analyses relating to trade issues in commodities, and other trade policy issues. The course will also cover topics relevant to globalized production, the balance of payments, exchange rate determination, and international financial economics. The objective of this course is to introduce the student to the basic analytical tools to evaluate the economic issues associated with the interaction of a country with the international markets.
goals: To introduce  the basic analytical tools to evaluate the economic issues associated with the interaction of a country with the international markets.
syllabus:
1\. Introduction to international trade

2\. Gains from Trade

3\. Specific-Factors Model of Trade

4\. Factor Proportions Models of Trade

5 Empirical Tests of Trade Patterns

6\. Trade Policy under Constant Returns to Scale and Perfect Competition

7\. Trade with Imperfect Competition and Increasing Returns

8\. Gravity Models

9\. Midterm

10 - 11.International Trade with Heterogeneous Firms

12\. Trade Policy under Imperfect Competition

13\. Introduction to international macroeconomics

14\. National and International Accounts and Transactions

15 - 16. Nominal and Real Exchange Rates

17\. Review

18\. Final
